main_definition: Having been harmed or impaired in some way, often resulting from accidental damage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physically harmed by force or pressure.
meanings_and_examples.example: The car was damaged in the collision.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Negatively affected or impaired in functioning.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her reputation was damaged after the scandal broke out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Compromised or ruined, especially in terms of value or condition.
meanings_and_examples.example: The antique vase is severely damaged and its value has decreased significantly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Made less effective through a loss of quality, integrity, or strength.
meanings_and_examples.example: His health was damaged due to excessive smoking over the years.
